description: Rear roof extension, and installation of one roof light; single storey side/rear (wrap around) extension; first floor side and rear extension; conversion of a garage into a habitable room including associated external alteration involving the insertion of a window in lieu of the garage door opening; alteration to external elevations.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings: Proposed Location Plan (ref. CR/09); Proposed Ground Floor Plan (ref. CR/10); Proposed First Floor Plan (ref. CR/11); Proposed Second Floor Plan (ref. CR/12); Proposed Roof Plan (ref. CR/13); Proposed Section A-A (ref. CR/14); Proposed Front Elevation (ref. CR/15); Proposed Rear Elevation (ref. CR/16); Proposed North Elevation (ref. CR/17); and Proposed South Elevation (ref. CR/18)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Details of the main front door shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any alterations to the front entrance are commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the development harmonises with the character and appearance of the dwelling and would preserve the special character and appearance of the Hanger Hill (Haymills) Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 , 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016). | Details of the replacement windows shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced (except ground work) and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The details shall include materials, transoms, glazing and ironmongery. Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the development harmonises with the character and appearance of the dwelling and would preserve the special character and appearance of the Hanger Hill (Haymills) Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 , 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016).
